page.title: 05Family Trees 2
page.content:
In the Burgess Rolls there are details of people, their occupations, when they were born , and when they died . You can also look at microfilms of old newspapers.
When you have found the information you need, you then see where it fits. If you come across a name but there are no details, and all you know is the parish in which the person lived, you may visit the church in the parish. After you have looked inside , you go and look around the graveyard. (This needs patience because with seeing so many graves you think that you are going to be here for the rest of your life.)
Some people now make a business out of searching for other people's ancestors.
